text: The earth is 15 years from a period of low solar activity similar to that last seen during the "mini ice-age" of the 17th century, when the Thames froze.
Solar activity will fall by 60 per cent as two waves of fluid "effectively cancel each other out", Prof Valentina Zharkova said in a presentation to the National Astronomy Meeting in Llandudno.
CORRECTION: An earlier version of this article inaccurately stated that scientists have predicted bitterly cold winters in the 2030s, "similar to freezing conditions of the late 17th century".
